categories: Category:The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook recipes

nodes.text: Fritzle fries were a foodstuff made with fried batter. The fries were served at Freerago's Satellite Diner and Motel which orbited the planet Hosnian Prime. Ten years before the human male Han Solo led a hunt for Fyzen Gor, Solo ate the fries along with other foods and beverages during a long, boring stakeout at the diner. The Hosnian Cataclysm in 34 ABY was presumed to have ended their availability from Freerago, the Gamorrean who owned the establishment.

Freerago's friend, the Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs, believed Freerago's kitchen droids had cooked the best fritzle fries in the galaxy. Tuggs included a recipe for them in his cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was published sometime after the Battle of Takodana in 34 ABY. He recommended seasoning them with Nerfsteak Seasoning, dipping them in Emulsauce, or serving them as a side dish with his Fried Endorian Tip-Yip.

Fritzle fries first appeared in the 2018 novel Last Shot by Daniel José Older. They were first pictured in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel. The out-of-universe recipe uses the ingredients tapioca pearls, plain yogurt, warm water, parmesan cheese, cayenne pepper, and rice flour, with an oil such as canola oil for frying.
